question_text: A company prints instructional booklets using duplex printing. Some pages appear upside down when folded. What is the most appropriate solution?
answer_options: Switch from portrait to landscape orientation
Adjust the duplex setting to flip on the correct edge
Reduce the print resolution to 300 DPI
correct_answer: Adjust the duplex setting to flip on the correct edge
explanation: Incorrect flip settings (long vs. short edge) on duplex printers can cause back-side pages to appear upside down when printed in booklet form.
